Chronicals of Lunarsword: Prolgue

By Anonymous873 on Sunday, July 21, 2002 - 11:01 am:

Disclaimer: Chronicals of Lunarsword is a
fanfiction to Race Against Darkness and the
owner of RAD is Ashlee Leidtke. If you want to
read RAD or any other of her stories, go to her
homepage at www.geocities.com/liligirl87/
Mystery.html With that being said, On with the
story.

Prologue


These were dark, wild times. Creatures with
powers of the Elements roamed free. This
made it doubly tough for normal creatures
because things like the Earth Elementals
could confine them in vines, the Electric ones
could shock them in to paralyses, Water could
drown them and then eat the carcasses, Wind
could box them in with the most powerful
winds and then devour them, Fire could
scorch them if they so much as touched it.
Darkness could just kill them outright but
preferred to hypnotize. But luckily for the
normal creatures, they had one on their side,
The Elemental of Light. It wasn’t really on any
ones side, For it had been the cause of all
this, It was the First and it had created the
rest. However once it saw the destruction they
created, It vowed to help any creature. Every
creature knew this tale, Yet none had ever
survived going to the Elemental, They had
always been killed on the way. But our
character Lunarsword intended to make it.
When you hear of ‘catlike reflexes’ your
hearing of a normal cat. Lunarsword was
much faster than that. He looked on the
outside like a regular cat, and on the inside to.
But he was special, he was predicted to help
seal the Elementals. He had better reflexes
then a normal cat and and could avoid almost
any type of attack with a quick jump and could
usually counter an attack with his long claws,
that was another odd feature about him, his
claws were four inches long at full extension,
and that was what gave him the edge over
predators. They would tease him, stay just out
of range of a normal cats claws and he would
shoot his claws out and usually imbed them
in the predators nose. And lastly, he could
sense Elementals even when they were out of
sight, smell and audibility, They were always
easy to sense but when they were close he
could practically feel them. For the past few
days he had begun to feel a good Elemental,
The Light Elemental, He was getting close,
but so was his competition, The only Dark
Element was out to kill the Light Elemental.
However he knew that Light Elemental had a
small chance to beat the Dark Elemental but
not a big one.

The only Light Elemental was in the form of a
griffin. He sat back, pleased. The creature
actually had a chance to get to him! It would
be a first. The creature was getting close but
so was the Dark Elemental. He was ahead
but losing ground as the Dark Elemental sped
on.

The Dark Elemental snarled. He could sense
a creature in front of him. Since he liked
destruction he would kill the creature. If it was
going for the Light Elemental it would never
get there.
